nodes.bodyText:
Everywhere you identified proper Java's module dependencies like in this case @boris-unckel
you can eliminate dependency on deprecated 'wrapper' javax.api module that
was bringing in all dependencies you identified here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,12 +21,16 @@
   ~ Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA
   ~ 02110-1301 USA, or see the FSF site: http://www.fsf.org.
   -->

+<module xmlns="urn:jboss:module:1.9" name="com.fasterxml.jackson.core.jackson-databind">
+
      <resources>
         <artifact name="${com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind}"/>
     </resources>
-
     <dependencies>
+        <module name="java.desktop"/>
+        <module name="java.logging"/>
+        <module name="java.sql"/>
+        <module name="java.xml"/>

nodes.bodyText:
@ropalka I have removed the dependencies, there is a comment in place now: <!--WFLY-14219 Remove deprecated <module name="javax.api"/> -->
The JDK8 fails are not caused by the removal. I have run a test, undoing the removal everywhere, JDK8 still fails within the same tests and reason. One can reproduce that JDK11 runs without error and JDK8 fails. Can you please give advice:

Howto make jboss modules give a relevant and good trace to analyse the issue?
What rules are relevant for the module descriptors to work with both JDK8 and JDK11?


Is the order of modules relevant: all java.* and/or jdk.* modules first? all java.* and/or jdk.* modules last?
Does the jdk.unsupported module work with Java 8 or is the WildFly-Core module "sun.jdk" still needed (even it is deprecated?)
Other rules?

Sample for the first (others completely different)

nodes.bodyText:
@ropalka I have tested some more: For every module which is imported with service somewhere I added a provides-service-withclass section in the module descriptor, based on the services in the corresponding JAR. This does not help for any of the JDK8 cases, but totally breaks the JDK11 build. I assume modules which import several other modules with their services re-export them, currently implicit and with my change lacking the explicit way.
I will stop for now and wait for your analysis and advice.

Shouldn't the 'slot' value now be incorporated in the 'name'?  @ropalka ?

nodes.bodyText:
The ee-9 variant of this has export=true:
        <!-- java.instrument export due to jdeps result -->
        <module name="java.instrument" export="true"/>

I think that's needed here as ClassTransformer throws IllegalClassFormatException in JPA 2.2 as well:
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/jpa-api/blob/2.2-2.2.3-RELEASE/api/src/main/java/javax/persistence/spi/ClassTransformer.java#L61
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,13 +22,17 @@
   ~ 02110-1301 USA, or see the FSF site: http://www.fsf.org.
   -->
 
-<module xmlns="urn:jboss:module:1.7" name="javax.persistence.api">
-    <dependencies>
-        <!-- PersistenceUnitInfo needs javax.sql.DataSource -->
-        <module name="javax.api" export="true"/>
-    </dependencies>
+<module xmlns="urn:jboss:module:1.9" name="javax.persistence.api">
 
     <resources>
         <artifact name="${jakarta.persistence:jakarta.persistence-api}"/>
     </resources>
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <module name="java.instrument"/>

nodes.bodyText:
@bstansberry
Thanks for your feedback. I have fixed it.
